taskbody.context:
You can filter activities either in the Open or Completed page based on the filter applied to the selected columns. Select appearing next to the column name and then select required filters from the menu to include in the list. You also can drag a column to the column header to group the downtime events based on the column selected. criteria that you enter.
By default, in the Open page, a numeric value in red indicating the number of overdue activities appears as shown in the following image. You can select the numeric value to view all activities that are overdue.
Numeric Value for the Overdue Activities

step.cmd: Select the tab for which you want to apply a filter.
Select appearing next to the column name.
As needed, select the applicable filter options, and then select Apply.

info.p:
You can select the filter options as described in the following table.
OptionDescription
EquipmentSelect an equipment associated with the activities.
Event TypeSelect a type of event associated with the activities.
StatusSelect one or more of the following statuses associated with the activities in the Completed page:
Completed: Select this status to filter completed activities.
Skipped: Select this status to filter skipped activities.
System Completed: Select this status to filter activities set as completed by the system.
Select one or more of the following statuses associated with the activities in the Open page:
Overdue: Select this status to filter overdue activities.
In Progress: Select this status to filter incomplete activities.
Not Started: Select this status to filter activities not yet performed.

taskbody.result:
The activities based on the specified filtered criteria appears.
To reset the filter options to their default setting, select , select Select All from the filter options, and then select Apply.
